intro: Oxypetalum insigne var. burchellii, commonly known as the Burchell's oxypetalum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically produces bright yellow or orange flowers that are clustered in spherical or conical shapes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
